summary: This is an email from an FBI Special Agent in New York to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, apologizing for a delayed response due to being 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case' and offering to schedule a call regarding a 'Nygard call'.

persons.name: Sean
persons.context: The sender of the email, an FBI Special Agent in New York, who apologizes for a delayed response because he was 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case' and offers to schedule a call.

events.title: FBI Agent Follow-up on Nygard Call
events.description: An FBI Special Agent in New York emails the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to apologize for a delayed response and to schedule a call regarding a 'Nygard call', noting he was previously 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case'.

keyFacts: An FBI Special Agent was 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case' in late June/early July 2020, indicating ongoing investigative activity.
The email is a follow-up regarding a 'Nygard call', suggesting a potential connection or parallel investigation involving Peter Nygard.
The correspondence is between the FBI New York Field Office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
